Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CPing::CPing ( const HWND  hMessageWindow,
const char *  c_pszHost,
const bool  c_bResolveAddress = false,
const unsigned int  c_uTimeout = 4000,
const unsigned int  c_uSleep = 1000,
const unsigned int  c_uUnreachableThreshold = 4,
const unsigned int  c_uBufferSize = 32,
const unsigned int  c_uTtl = 60 
) throw (CPingException)

Ping class constructor.

The defaults are roughly taken from the windows command line utility ping.exe.

Parameters:
hMessageWindow window handle for message notification
c_pszHost hostname or IP address to ping
c_uSleep time between two ICMP packets
c_uTimeout how long to wait for an answer
c_uBufferSize ping packet size. Default is 32 bytes.
c_uTtl time to live. Default is 60
c_uUnreachableThreshold how many pings in a row have to fail until a host is considered unreachable.
c_bResolveAddress true, if you want ping to do a reverse lookup, false otherwise.

Member Function Documentation

const char* CPing::getHostName (  )  const [inline]

Return the name of the host.

Returns:
the host name if Ping was created with name resolution, a string representation of the IP address otherwise.

Definition at line 85 of file Ping.h.

Referenced by WinMain().

const bool CPing::isUp (  )  [inline]

Return the current status of the pinged host.

Returns:
false, if the host is down, true, if the host is up (or less than threshold packets have not been answered.

Starts pinging the host.

unsigned int __stdcall CPing::threadFunc ( void *  pInstance  )  [static]

Static member function used for _beginthreadex.

The member will lookup if its parameter is a valid instance of CPing and will then call pInstance->pingThread().
